body:
These files are maintained by Vim; please report the issue there. We will port any fixes they make.

@brianhuster

the funny thing is, this does work in vim, as stated in the report.

for some reason these files are very different in nvim 0.11.0 and vim 9.1.

comment at the top states that both files have their last change at `2025 Feb 27`, but "neovim version" has 81 line, while the "vim version" has 134 lines.

there are many differences, but from my understanding, the fix is the two last code lines:

```vim
let &cpo = s:cpo_save
unlet s:cpo_save
```

they are present in the vim github repository: https://github.com/vim/vim/blob/c29b533cf1a1c31a14b5c7b2b3daa806c2d90ec0/runtime/ftplugin/lua.vim#L185-L186,

but not in the neovim github repository: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c1d21492a66c8bc3cdb390b5f4cb24ad16516853/runtime/ftplugin/lua.vim

and the even more fun thing is that my runtime files are outdated for some reason (while packages are, of course, up-to-date) and don't have their last change at `2025 Apr 04` in both cases, but the issue still persists. as i checked with github blame, this fix was introduced in vim repository 14 years ago.

is this intended?

_which_ version of Vim 9.1? We need the exact patch level. Also test the latest release (Nvim 0.11.1) as well as `master`.

(Runtime files are normally not backported to the release branch. If your runtime files seem wonky, you may have a messed up installation; best to remove everything and reinstall from scratch.)

**EDIT:** The loc difference is due to Vim adding a vim9script version, which is irrelevant for Neovim. Looks like the manual port was messed up.
Yep, they got moved to after the `vim9script` block and thus forgotten. Easy, backportable, fix @brianhuster

also, just to double check, i manually edited this runtime file and added these two lines to the end (because statements above just were my guesses)

```vim
let &cpo = s:cpo_save
unlet s:cpo_save
```

and everything works as expected
No, you simply messed up porting the last Vim patch.

issue.title: fix: cpoptions is reset in Lua file

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
closes #33670
